Name: Vase with elongated neck
Description: This beautiful vase of terracotta comes from the excavations of W.F. Petrie at Diospolis Parva. It is characterised by a rounded belly and an elongated neck provided with a large rounded edge/brim. This type of receptacle, which needed a stand in view of the round bottom, dates from the end of the 1st Intermediate Period or more probably to the beginning of the Middle Kingdom.
